author: Corinne Ramey
title: Former New York Assembly Speaker Found Guilty on All Counts in Corruption Retrial
text:
Sheldon Silver, former longtime speaker of New York’s Assembly and once one of the state’s most powerful lawmakers, was convicted Friday of all counts after his retrial on public-corruption charges.
Following a nearly two-week trial, a Manhattan jury found Mr. Silver, a Democrat, guilty of seven counts of honest-services fraud, extortion and money laundering.
